greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{i=0..2n} B(i)*C(2n+1,i)*6^i where B(i) are the Bernoulli numbers, C(2n,i) the binomial coefficients.
comment: Related to those formulas derived from Bernoulli polynomials: Sum_{k>0} sin(k*x)/k^(2n+1) = (-1)^(n+1)/2*x^(2n+1)/(2n+1)!*Sum_{i=0..2n} (2Pi/x)^i*B(i)*C(2n+1,i).
formula: a(n) = 6^(2*n - 1)*B(2*n - 1,1/6), where B(n,x) denotes the n-th Bernoulli polynomial. Cf. A002111, A009843, A069852.
Conjecturally, a(n) = 2 * the unsigned numerator of B(2*n - 1,1/6). If true then this sequence is a bisection of 2*A158073.
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, May 01 2002
